cards.summary: Use ambulatory or home blood pressure monitoring to confirm diagnosis.
cards.detail:
{{#patient}}You recently had a high blood pressure reading, but do not have a recorded diagnosis of hypertension. Discuss out of office blood pressure monitoring with your care team.{{/patient}}{{#careTeam}}In adults with suspected hypertension and without diagnostic uncertainty or BP variability, use Ambulatory Blood Pressure Monitoring or HBPM for diagnostic confirmation.{{/careTeam}}|[ { "id": "contact-suggestion", "label": "Contact care team", "type": "suggestion-link", "actions": [{"label":"Contact your care team about out of office blood pressure measurements", "url":"/contact?token=office-bps"}] } ]|at-most-one|[{"label":"https://www.heart.org/en/health-topics/high-blood-pressure/understanding-blood-pressure-readings/monitoring-your-blood-pressure-at-home", "url": "https://www.heart.org/en/health-topics/high-blood-pressure/understanding-blood-pressure-readings/monitoring-your-blood-pressure-at-home"},
